column4: is it possible that installing kde would "break" some of my current apps?
no, you only install it next to your gnome insta;l;

ok does it detect in bios?
ok, do you see it in sudo fdisk -l
ok then you'll need to add it to /etc/fsta to make it mount

then check ntfs-3g if you want it writable

no idea in synaptic, id use sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
